results.title: Puzzle children
results.creator_credit: Stephen Beck, WQED and Bill Davis
results.brief_description: Discusses learning disabilities in children and identifies some of the myths that prevent an accurate understanding of these problems. Profiles four children with specific learning handicaps. Including comments by their parents, teachers, and special educators. Hosted by Julie Andrews and Bill Bixby.

results.title: Putting yourself together
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
Two teenagers and counsellor Daniel Whiteside take a close look at how to think your way past the put-downs or problems that often weaken your self-image. The give-and-take between the three, draws us into the film and challenges us all to start taking control of this part of our lives.

results.title: Putting waste to work: energy from methane
results.brief_description: In the search for energy alternatives to fossil fuels, a number of ways have been discovered to employ the methane rich gas produced from various waste materials. This video explores a number of situations where this valuable resource has been harnessed. These include a municipal land fill tip and a sewage treatment plant. Various aspects of science, technology and society are examined.

results.title: Putting the atom to work
results.brief_description: Atomic power in medicine, food preservation, and generation of electric power, future uses, and the dangers of nuclear energy. Calder Hall and Chapel Cross nuclear power stations. Britain’s first nuclear power programme consists of a number of stations. In 1962 the first of these started operating at Berkeley. A simple account of applied nuclear fission in Britain, showing the operation of nuclear power stations and production of radioactive isotopes.

results.title: Putting people away
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Psychiatrists have the responsibility for deciding who should and who shouldn’t be locked away, whose behaviour is merely eccentric and who is in fact, mentally ill. This program looks at the effect on people’s civil liberties when they are forcibly detained and questions whether it is necessary for the mentally ill to be hospitalised at all.

results.title: Putting out the garbage
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Video Projects and Julie Harris
results.brief_description: Domestic violence is the most frequently occurring and under reported crime in Australia. It includes emotional, physical, sexual, financial and social abuse. This video is designed for use by women, community groups, police, schools, professional training bodies and educational organisations.
